intro: Thelypteris qinlingensis, commonly known as Qinling water fern, is a species of fern native to the mountainous regions of central China. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or stream sides. Its reproductive structures, including sori, are located on the underside of the fronds. Thelypteris qinlingensis plays an important role in maintaining the ecological balance of its habitat.
